inlineContent.text: - integrate in-app purchases and subscriptions in your mobile app in 2 lines of code. No server code required. Apphud works with all apps on iOS, iPadOS, MacOS, tvOS, watchOS and Android. Cross-platform support out of the box.
- view key subscription metrics in our dashboard and charts, like MRR, Subscriber Retention (Cohorts), Churn rate, ARPU, Trial Conversions, Proceeds, Refunds, etc.

- Send subscription events to your favorite third party platforms with automatic currency conversion. Choose from 18 integrations, including: AppsFlyer, Adjust, Branch, Firebase, Amplitude, Mixpanel, OneSignal, Facebook, TikTok, and more. Custom Server-to-Server webhooks and APIs are also available.
- Test different in-app purchases and paywalls. Run experiments to find the best combination of prices and purchase screen parameters that maximize ROI.
- solution overcomes IDFA limitations in the post iOS 14.5 era. Using this solution you can run paid campaigns in Facebook or TikTok and get real-time attribution with nearly 100% accuracy.

- Apphud may win back lapsed subscribers, reduce churn rate, get cancellation insights, send push notifications and many more using the mechanics below. This mechanics are called Rules. Choose between manual, scheduled and automated rule. Use our visual web editor to create you custom screen or screen sequence for Rule, and analyze user stats from every created screen.

content.text: The easiest way to integrate in-app subscriptions

inlineContent.text: Apphud provides ready-to-use infrastructure for all kinds of in-app purchases. Integrate Apphud SDK and implement 3 lines of code:

abstract.text: Apphud is all-in-one infrastructure for your app growth. Apphud helps marketing and product management teams to make right decisions based on the data and tools.
Deprecated. Use
method instead.
Pass your own modal presentation style to Apphud Screens. This is useful since iOS 13 presents in page sheet style by default.
Called when Apphud SDK detects a deferred or interrupted purchase, this may happen when SCA confirmation is needed, in the case of parental control and some other cases

Returns array of subscriptions that user ever purchased. Empty array means user never purchased a subscription. If you have just one subscription group in your app, you will always receive just one subscription in an array.
This callback is called when
s are fetched from the App Store. Note that you have to add all product identifiers in Apphud Dashboard > Product Hub > Products.
Logs “Paywall Closed” event that will be used in Apphud Dashboard.
Called when user ID has been changed. Use this if you implement integrations with Analytics services.
Public Callback object provide -> Bool
Submit attribution data to Apphud from your attribution network provider.
(New) Overrides action after survey option is selected or feeback sent is tapped. Default is “thankAndClose”.
This delegate method is only called if no other screen is selected as button action in Apphud Screens editor.
You can return
value and use
property of
variable to push your own view controller into hierarchy.
Implements mechanism of purchasing In-App Purchase initiated directly from the App Store page.
List of available attribution providers
has to make Int in order to support Objective-C
A public protocol that provides access to Apphud’s main public methods, describing the behavior of the Rules state and custom Rules view presentation
User property initializer class with reserved property names.
Returns paywalls configured in Apphud Dashboard > Product Hub > Paywalls. Each paywall contains an array of
objects that you use for purchase.
is Apphud’s wrapper around StoreKit’s
Implements
mechanism. Basically it just sends current App Store Receipt to Apphud and returns subscriptions info.
You can grant free promotional subscription to user. Returns
in a callback if promotional was granted. After this
method will return
If you want to use A/B experiments while running SDK in
you should manually send paywall identifier to Apphud using this method.
Custom Apphud class containing all information about customer subscription.
Returns paywalls configured in Apphud Dashboard > Product Hub > Paywalls. Each paywall contains an array of
objects that you use for purchase.
is Apphud’s wrapper around StoreKit’s
Checks whether the given product is eligible for purchasing introductory offer (
or
modes).

Called when Apphud SDK detects a purchase that was made outside of Apphud SDK purchase methods. It is also useful to intercept purchases made using Promo Codes for in-app purchases. If user redeems promo code for in-app purchase in the App Store, then opens the app, this delegate method will be called, so you will be able to handle successful payment on your side.
An object associated with purchases container (Paywall).

If you already have a live app with paying users and you want Apphud to track their purchases, you should import their App Store receipts into Apphud. Call this method at launch of your app for your paying users. This method should be used only to migrate existing paying users that are not yet tracked by Apphud.
This is Apphud’s internal class.
Apphud is all-in-one infrastructure for your app growth. Apphud helps marketing and product management teams to make right decisions based on the data and tools.
You can return
to this delegate method if you want to delay Apphud Screen presentation.
Set custom user property. Value must be one of:
Public Callback object provide -> [String: Bool]
is Apphud’s wrapper around StoreKit’s
A public protocol that provides access to Apphud’s main public methods, describing the behavior of the user and the state of his subscriptions.
Called when any of non renewing purchases changes. Called when purchase is made or has been refunded.
Initializes Apphud SDK. You should call it during app launch.

to ignore this rule. You should only do this if you want to handle your rules by yourself. Default implementation is
General class that is returned in purchase block.
Class for storing user data
Logs “Paywall Shown” event that will be used in Apphud Dashboard.
This class will contain some utils, more will be added in the future.
An object containing all incoming Rule information.
Apphud class which describes products permission groups
Initiates purchase of
object from your
and automatically submits App Store Receipt to Apphud.
Called when user successfully purchased product in Apphud purchase screen.
Called when user tapped on purchase button in Apphud purchase screen.
Returns
if user has active subscription or non renewing purchase (lifetime).
These are three types of actions that are returned in
delegate method
Status of the subscription. It can only be in one state at any moment.

Returns an array of all standard in-app purchases (consumables, nonconsumables or nonrenewing subscriptions) that this user has ever purchased. Purchases are cached on device. This array is sorted by purchase date. Apphud only tracks consumables if they were purchased after integrating Apphud SDK.
Checks whether the given product is eligible for purchasing any of it’s promotional offers.
Apphud’s wrapper around
Custom Apphud class containing all information about customer non-renewing purchase
Entry point of the Apphud SDK. It provides access to all its features.
Return
instance from which you want to present given Apphud controller. If you don’t implement this method, then top visible viewcontroller from key window will be used.
Custom Apphud wrapper around NSError.
